body.p: Virginia soldier. Virginia native. Son of Peter Johnston and Mary Wood Johnston. Married to Lydia McLane Johnston on July 10, 1845. Relocated to Abington, Virginia. Attended Abingdon Academy. Graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, in 1829. Veteran of the Black Hawk War. Civilian topographical engineer in Florida during the Second Seminole War. Brevet captain as a topographical engineer in Florida, in 1838. Veteran of the Mexican-American War. Quartermaster general for the U.S. Army. Resigned from the U.S. Army in April 1861. Commissioned a brigadier general in the Confederate Army. Commanded garrison at Harpers Ferry, Virginia. Commissioned a full general in August 1861. Commanded Confederate forces in defense of Richmond, Virginia. Transferred to the Department of the West in November 1862. Commanded the Army of Tennessee in North Carolina in February 1865. Surrendered to General William T. Sherman on April 26, 1865.
